articles.headline: A Console With Quirks, for Tinkerers
articles.snippet: Ouya is an economy-model game console with open-source, hackable innards and a collection of some truly great and some completely dreadful games.
articles.abstract: Ouya is an economy-model game console with open-source, hackable innards and a collection of some truly great and some completely dreadful games.
articles.lead_paragraph: For every Prada, there’s a Gap. For every Four Seasons, there’s a Holiday Inn Express. For every Lamborghini, there’s a Corolla.

articles.headline: In Tourre Trial, S.E.C. Wages Battle Against Its Own Witness
articles.snippet: The S.E.C.’s plan in its lawsuit against a former Goldman Sachs trader was thrown into disarray in several hours of combative testimony on Wednesday.
articles.abstract: The S.E.C.’s plan in its lawsuit against a former Goldman Sachs trader was thrown into disarray in several hours of combative testimony on Wednesday.
articles.byline: By Susanne Craig and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: JPMorgan in Talks to Settle Energy Manipulation Case for $500 Million
articles.snippet: JPMorgan Chase is aiming to settle accusations by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission that it devised “manipulative schemes” that transformed “money-losing power plants into powerful profit centers.
articles.abstract: JPMorgan Chase is aiming to settle accusations by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission that it devised “manipulative schemes” that transformed “money-losing power plants into powerful profit centers.
articles.byline: By Ben Protess and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

articles.headline: Digital Tools to Curb Snooping
articles.snippet: While no technological tool is perfect, there are ways to limit one’s digital footprint.
articles.abstract: While no technological tool is perfect, there are ways to limit one’s digital footprint.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Let’s be clear. Your personal information online is not always yours to control.

articles.headline: Contaminated Lunches Kill 22 Children in India
articles.snippet: The episode left dozens hospitalized, and officials said they believed the food had been contaminated by cooking oil stored in a container formerly used for insecticides.
articles.abstract: The episode left dozens hospitalized, and officials said they believed the food had been contaminated by cooking oil stored in a container formerly used for insecticides.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — The children complained that the free lunch at their state school — rice, beans, potato curry and soy balls — tasted odd. The cook gave it a taste, too. Within half an hour they all began to suffer severe stomach pains followed by vomiting and diarrhea, and within hours at least 22 of the children were dead and dozens of others remained hospitalized, said officials in the northeastern state of Bihar.
articles.byline: By Gardiner Harris and Hari Kumar

articles.headline: Pushing the Right Buttons
articles.snippet: Apple’s steps to reimagine television, like teaming up with ESPN, stand in stark contrast to efforts by Google to compete with established companies.
articles.abstract: Apple’s steps to reimagine television, like teaming up with ESPN, stand in stark contrast to efforts by Google to compete with established companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Apple wanted to revolutionize cellphones, it held hands with AT&T. The partners fought endlessly, but the public loved the finished product: the iPhone.

articles.headline: Momentum Shifts in Syria, Bolstering Assad’s Position
articles.snippet: Though his country is in shambles, President Bashar al-Assad now seems better positioned to hang on to power than he has been for most of Syria’s two-year civil war.
articles.abstract: Though his country is in shambles, President Bashar al-Assad now seems better positioned to hang on to power than he has been for most of Syria’s two-year civil war.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Not long ago, rebels on the outskirts of Damascus were peppering the city with mortar rounds, government soldiers were defecting in droves and reports circulated of new territory pried from the grip of President Bashar al-Assad.

articles.headline: Putin Critic Gets 5-Year Jail Term, Setting Off Protests
articles.snippet: Aleksei A. Navalny, Russia’s most resonant opposition voice and a Moscow mayoral candidate, was sentenced to five years in prison on embezzlement charges.
articles.abstract: Aleksei A. Navalny, Russia’s most resonant opposition voice and a Moscow mayoral candidate, was sentenced to five years in prison on embezzlement charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: KIROV, Russia — Russia’s most prominent opposition leader was sentenced to five years in prison on Thursday for embezzlement, setting off protests that condemned the verdict as part of a campaign by President Vladimir V. Putin to corral the opposition and block the rise of a popular challenger.

articles.headline: British Inquiry Ties 787 Fire to Beacon
articles.snippet: American aviation officials said they would review recommendations by British authorities to disconnect batteries in the emergency transmitters on all Boeing 787s.
articles.abstract: American aviation officials said they would review recommendations by British authorities to disconnect batteries in the emergency transmitters on all Boeing 787s.
articles.lead_paragraph: After British authorities urged American regulators to order airlines to disconnect the batteries in the emergency transmitters on Boeing 787s, the Federal Aviation Administration took a more measured approach, saying that it would review the matter.
